unit_learning_outcomes.description: Investigate research in sensory disability and synthesise findings to make improvements in identified focus areas for improvement.
Apply understanding of assessment strategies, including formal and informal, diagnostic, formative and summative approaches to assess and report on student learning.
Critically reflect on level of competency of the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers (and relevant elaborations) in order to formulate an improvement teaching plan
Create, and deliver lesson sequences using knowledge of student learning and evaluate effectiveness of implemented teaching strategies

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to MDisabilityStud and 40cp from SPED units at 8000 level and permission by special approval

assessments.description: Practical experiences in the field of sensory disability
Practical experiences in the field of sensory disability

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Infrequent attendance, On location at placement
Session 2, Infrequent attendance, On location at placement
Session 1, Special circumstances, On location at placement
Session 2, Special circumstances, On location at placement
data.subject_search_title: SPED8910 - Critical Reflection and Professional Experience for Teachers in Sensory Disability
data.description: This unit provides students with the opportunity to observe, plan, implement, manage and evaluate teaching programs as part of undertaking 16 days of professional experiences. Central to this professional experience is a critical reflection model that guides and highlights the student's awareness regarding the role that research plays in strengthening their professional skills and knowledge. Using critical reflection students will demonstrate professional practice that optimises outcomes for people with sensory disability.
data.search_title: SPED8910 - Critical Reflection and Professional Experience for Teachers in Sensory Disability
